verses.verse: (Book I) ((230 1-41)) (The Two Ways) (Job 21.16; Ps 17.4; 26.5; Prov 4.14; Jer 15.17) Happy are those who do not follow the advice of the wicked or take the path that sinners tread or sit in the seat of scoffers,
(Josh 1.8; Ps 119.35) but their delight is in the law of the LORD, and on his law they meditate day and night.
(Gen 39.3; Ps 128.2; Jer 17.8; Ezek 47.12) They are like trees planted by streams of water, which yield their fruit in its season, and their leaves do not wither. In all that they do, they prosper.
(Job 21.18; Isa 17.13) The wicked are not so but are like chaff that the wind drives away.
(Ps 5.5; 9.7, 8, 16; 111.1; 149.1) Therefore the wicked will not stand in the judgment nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous,
(Ps 9.3-6; 37.18; 2 Tim 2.19) for the LORD watches over the way of the righteous, but the way of the wicked will perish.
